p.s: Reading the statement Shakespeare never grows old.He continues to inspire each new generation by Norman J. Lund and scene number seven, act one from the Tragedietragedy of Macbeth, I increasingly asked myself the question if studying Shakespeare in school is usefulluseful or not.
Now I would like to eleborateelaborate my point of view related to the question.
First it is important to mention that Shakespeare wrote about fundamental experiences of life, for example love, hate, greed, death or jealousy.
Surely Shakespeare wrote thisthese plays to be performed on stage and not to be analysed line by line.
A close text analysis contradicts the original purpose and of course the students just worry about rhetorical devices instead of enjoying the plot.
But today it is possible that students can access the plays with different media like watching a movie or a stage performance.
In addition this makes the work with one of the plays very attractive for the most students.
In fact, there will be less students intimidated due to the old plays and the ancient language.

It might be true that students prefer topics which they can identify easily with, so that plays from authors which address todaystoday's problems of racism or inequality might be much more important for todaystoday's audience.
Moreover the moral questions about good and evil or justice and fairness are timeless and offer parallels to more current debates, which can be discussed in class.
Furthermore the plays invite to modern interpretations that reflectsreflect studentsstudents' 21th21st century reality.
One might say now, that there are other actors who have the same classification like Karl May, Jane Austen, Agatha Christie or even newer ones like Joanne K. Rowling.
Of course this is true, but the impact of Shakespeare on the culture and language is without competition.
Many modern films, songs, poems and so on refer to famous passages of his plays and are part of the general knowledge.
Finally it should be said that Shakespeare wrote about his subjects perfectly with clarity and beauty while keeping a balance with irony.
He knows the human soul and could show us ourselves, maybe even in extremextreme situations.
To sum up, after considering all the arguments mentioned above, I conclude that in my opinion the statement is true and that Shakespeare should be presented in school.
Important for me is that modern ways are used to study his plays, so that most of the students can get access to the writings and not only a few.
